Ken,
The Akasaka made some very nice sukashi guards in mantis motif.  Also the Shonai Shoami did excellent (non-sukashi) work as did Sekibun.

Jim


> 

Thanks Jim and Rich.  As for your above comments, I
think I have firmly established what I like.  Seperate
from these discussed pieces, I am seeking out various
other schools from the Mito Shoami type to have a
representation of all the schools that used the mantis
in their work.  My humble collection of 12 tsuba is
growing with representation of both kinko and sukashi.
I really would love to put out a book one day on just
mantis fittings.  Whoever owns that tsuba on the
Northern California site please feel free to leave
that to me in my will.  Given that however, I do like
these Mito tsuba and kinda like the idea of having a
potential dai-sho for mounting or at least 1 for
display and 1 for mounting.  Thanks again.
Ken
